title: CityBike: Toronto Bike Share Snapshot (Mar 2023 vs Mar 2024)
text:
Question. For a quick, scoped snapshot: How did Bike Share Toronto usage differ between March 2023 and March 2024, and when/where are the peaks most pronounced?
Why these months? March alone already has ~500k+ trips across the two years‚Äîenough to expose hourly/weekday patterns without boiling the ocean. I‚Äôll scale the scope later.
Stack. Excel (cleaning/validation) ¬∑ Tableau (dashboard) ¬∑ Python/SQL (planned)

title: CityBike: Toronto Bike Share Snapshot (Mar 2023 vs Mar 2024)
text:
Data & Scope

Source: Bike Share Toronto open data (Trips for Mar 2023 and Mar 2024)
Core fields: start time/end time, station names/IDs, trip duration, member type
Scope choice: one month per year to keep season similar yet volume high


Planned extension: add adjacent months to test before/after effects of downtown e-scooter restrictions (with citation).

title: CityBike: Toronto Bike Share Snapshot (Mar 2023 vs Mar 2024)
text:
Cleaning Workflow (Excel)
Goals: fix types, remove duplicates, handle nulls, and create analysis-ready columns.
Steps I took 1. Type fixes: coerced timestamps to datetime; durations to numeric minutes
2. Null handling: filtered rows with missing station IDs/time; documented counts
3. De-duplication: removed duplicates by (start_time, end_time, bike_id)
4. Derived columns: hour_of_day, weekday, is_member
5. Data issues log: tracked anomalies (e.g., negative durations, midnight spikes)


Decision note: trips < 2 minutes flagged (unlock/relocate). Included in totals but excluded in some visuals.

title: CityBike: Toronto Bike Share Snapshot (Mar 2023 vs Mar 2024)
text:
Findings (So Far)

Peak hours: weekday 17:00‚Äì18:00 strongest; 7‚Äì9 AM morning commute visible

Member mix: change in annual member % year-over-year (quantify after KPI lock)

Hotspots: downtown core stations dominate activity

2023 ‚Üí 2024: peak intensity appears higher in 2024 (confirm with final totals)


Limits: single month per year; weather unaccounted; no promo/fare context

title: CityBike: Toronto Bike Share Snapshot (Mar 2023 vs Mar 2024)
text:
What‚Äôs Next

Comparison dashboard (Mar 2023 vs Mar 2024 KPIs side-by-side)

E-scooter policy check with surrounding months (before/after) + citation

Python/SQL pipeline for reproducible cleaning & station-hour aggregations

Predictive baseline: simple hourly demand regression for top 10 stations

title: CityBike: Toronto Bike Share Snapshot (Mar 2023 vs Mar 2024)
text:
Repro Notes

Assumptions: local timezone; station names normalized by ID where possible

Files referenced: data_issues.xlsx (in this project folder), screenshots under /images/

Contact: Feedback welcome‚Äîthis will expand into a broader 2024 view + policy checks

title: Zain Ghias
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm Zain,
a third-year student at the University of Toronto Mississauga, majoring in Applied Statistics with minors in Computer Science and Math.
I‚Äôm currently working as a Software Developer Intern at a startup, but I‚Äôm shifting my focus toward Data Analytics, Data Science, and exploring areas like AI and Machine Learning. I‚Äôm planning to take more ML and stats courses next year, and I‚Äôm open to getting involved in research if it‚Äôs in something exciting or meaningful.
I like volleyball, table tennis, and basketball, and I try to balance screen time with touching grass and going on long walks, partly for my sanity.
Thanks for stopping by. Excited to see where this journey goes.
Get in touch: zain.ghias@mail.utoronto.ca
